Title: Streamripper: Multiple vulnerabilities
Synopsis:
Multiple buffer overflows have been discovered in Streamripper, allowing
    for user-assisted execution of arbitrary code.

Background.Text: Streamripper is a tool for extracting and recording mp3 files from a Shoutcast stream.

Description.Text: Stefan Cornelius from Secunia Research reported multiple buffer overflows in the http_parse_sc_header(), http_get_pls() and http_get_m3u() functions in lib/http.c when parsing overly long HTTP headers, or pls and m3u playlists with overly long entries.

Impact.Text: A remote attacker could entice a user to connect to a malicious server, possibly resulting in the remote execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application.

Workaround.Text: There is no known workaround at this time.

P.Text: All Streamripper users should upgrade to the latest version:
